decision_conditions: The proposed development would, fail to provide adequately designed off-street parking for both the host and proposed dwelling, which would rely on land outside of the applicants control to access the proposed dwelling, and which would be likely to lead to parking displacement on the road, such that the overall parking layout / arrangement would be detrimental to the safety of pedestrian and other road users, contrary to policies 6.13 and 6.9 of the London Plan MALP 2016, and policies DC33, DC35, DC61 and DC62 of the Havering Core Strategy and Development Control Policies DPD 2008.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: Consideration was given to seeking amendments, but given conflict with adopted planning policy, and that no minor changes to the scheme could overcome the inherent issues with the site and the scheme, it was considered expedient to issue a decision within statutory timeframes as opposed to seeking amendments and perpetually extending the deadline.
description: Demolition of existing garage, and the erection of 2 storey 3-bed end terrace dwelling (with associated car parking, raised patio and amenity space), and the erection of single storey rear extension and front porch to existing dwelling.
